3.6 Important points about PRINCE2 Agile and this manual
In order to correctly understand PRINCE2 Agile and this manual, the reader must be aware of the following eight guidance points which are intended to provide clarity where there is potential for ambiguity, and accuracy where there may be misconceptions. These points are summarized in Table 3.4 for quick reference.

1.All references to PRINCE2 refer to the edition created in 2017 (Managing Successful Projects with PRINCE2). This version is already enabled to work with agile; it just needs to be tailored to suit any given project. Configuring PRINCE2 in the most effective way for agile is a matter of where to put emphasis and where to add further levels of detailed guidance. Nothing needs to be removed or significantly changed, as this is achieved through blending agile into PRINCE2 and tuning PRINCE2 appropriately

B. Where to put the emphasis and where to add guidance should be decided when configuring PRINCE2 effectively.

When configuring PRINCE2, it is important to tailor the methodology to suit the specific needs of the project and organization. This involves deciding where to put the emphasis and where to add guidance, based on the project's objectives, scope, and requirements.

A supplier representative is partially assigned to the delivery team or to the senior supplier to contribute, or to be consulted about, specific technical or specialist information that may be of use to the project. This is a consultative role that provides general or detailed technical information relating to specific areas of the products being delivered.
Responsibilities may include:

•providing technical guidance on specific areas where appropriate (e.g. design, performance, releasing into operational use, ongoing support)
•communicating technical standards and guidance on areas such as technical compliance
•highlighting any areas that the project may impact directly or indirectly from a technical perspective.

Competencies include being:

•technically excellent
•proactive
•inquisitive.

They highlight areas that the project may impact from a technical perspective.
They are partially assigned to the delivery team.

The two statements that are key responsibilities of a supplier representative are:
They highlight areas that the project may impact from a technical perspective: A supplier representative is responsible for providing technical expertise and guidance to the project team, and for highlighting any technical considerations or constraints that may impact the project's scope, timeline, or budget.
They are partially assigned to the delivery team: A supplier representative may be assigned to work as part of the delivery team, and is responsible for delivering the products or services that are contracted with the project. As such, they play an important role in ensuring that the project's deliverables meet the required quality standards and specifications.

The purpose of the quality theme is to define and implement the means by which the project will verify products that are fit for purpose.
The initial idea will only be understood as a broad outline. This theme explains how the outline is developed so that all participants understand the quality attributes of the products to be delivered and then how project management will ensure that these requirements are subsequently delivered.

To answer the question, you should choose the option that best represents the primary purpose of the quality theme in PRINCE2. Based on that, the correct answer is D - To assess any potential improvements to a product. While A and C are also purposes of the quality theme in PRINCE2, they are not as central to the theme's primary objective as assessing potential improvements to a product.

Selected Answer: B
The PRINCE2 Agile behavior "Collaboration" emphasizes teamwork, shared responsibility, and collective ownership of tasks. A key advantage of collaboration is that team members can support and cover for each other, ensuring continuity even when individuals are unavailable.

If the question is asking for only one answer, then I would choose option D ("It uses learning to help improve products") as the primary advantage of using the collaboration behavior in PRINCE2 Agile. While experimentation and expansion of requirements are also important benefits of collaboration, the focus on continuous learning and improvement is a central tenet of the PRINCE2 Agile methodology and can lead to higher quality project outcomes.
